Author: jl777c#5810
Content: wallet.dat change addresses have up to 100 pregenerated

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if the change went to a change address in common, this indicates the wallet.dat was compromised

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: after the keypool is used up, the change addresses will diverge

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this does not appear to be a passphrase hack as there is no way the change address would also be compromised

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the fact that the change address is known gives very strong indication of what was compromised, just not know

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: gives me a thought.... should I try BSD? 游뱂

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: freeBSD or openBSD?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: it's been over a decade I tried BSD

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: only used it for servers

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: never for desktop

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: depends. if you value security over newer features, deraadts openbsd is for you

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: if you're after awesome stuff like working zfs and such, it maybe wiser to go for freebsd

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: i personally would choose netbsd, well knowing about its drawbacks anywhere outside of networking

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: theres also DragonFly BSD

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: i never tried it, but people say its not something you'll have to throw away your hdd because of installing it either

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: so maybe it's worth to check it out

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: having that said, you work on a OSX right?

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: half of your OS __Is__ in fact freebsd 游땔

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: oh, if CoCs mean a lot to you, or the behaviour they _SHOULD_ (but never will) help with, openbsd is wrong for you. do not ever read their mailinglist then :trollface:
